alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Grady, southwestern Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oklahoma City to near Blanchard to near Norge. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, southwestern Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Choctaw, Tuttle, Goldsby, Dibble, Valley Brook, Washington, Cole, Alex, Bridge Creek, Norge, Stanley Draper Lake and Tabler. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 102 and 130. Interstate 40 between mile markers 145 and 164. Interstate 44 between mile markers 73 and 125. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
